df-fl
blocks.content: Define the floor (greatest integer less than or equal to) function. See ~ flval for its value, ~ fllelt for its basic property, and ~ flcl for its closure. For example, ` ( |_ `` ( 3 / 2 ) ) = 1 ` while ` ( |_ `` -u ( 3 / 2 ) ) = -u 2 ` ( ~ ex-fl ). The term "floor" was coined by Ken Iverson. He also invented a mathematical notation for floor, consisting of an L-shaped left bracket and its reflection as a right bracket. In APL, the left-bracket alone is used, and we borrow this idea. (Thanks to Paul Chapman for this information.) (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2004.)

blocks.name: df-ceil
blocks.content: The ceiling (least integer greater than or equal to) function. Defined in ISO 80000-2:2009(E) operation 2-9.18 and the "NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions" , front introduction, "Common Notations and Definitions" section at ~ http://dlmf.nist.gov/front/introduction#Sx4 . See ~ ceilval for its value, ~ ceilge and ~ ceilm1lt for its basic properties, and ~ ceilcl for its closure. For example, ` ( |^ `` ( 3 / 2 ) ) = 2 ` while ` ( |^ `` -u ( 3 / 2 ) ) = -u 1 ` ( ~ ex-ceil ). The symbol ` |^ ` is inspired by the gamma shaped left bracket of the usual notation. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 19-May-2015.)

blocks.name: flval
blocks.content: Value of the floor (greatest integer) function. The floor of ` A ` is the (unique) integer less than or equal to ` A ` whose successor is strictly greater than ` A ` . (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm flval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wceq(cfv(cfl, c0), crio(s0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cr, cfl, crio(s0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))), crio(s0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))
  riotabidv(s0, cz, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), cle)
  breq1(cv(hs0), c0, clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))
  df-fl(hs0, s0)
  riotaex(s0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(crio(s0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm flval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℝ →(⌊ ` c0)= iota(s0 ∈ ℤ,(s0[≤]c0 ∧ c0[<](s0[+]1))))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cr, cfl, iota(s0 ∈ ℤ,(s0[≤]c0 ∧ c0[<](s0[+]1))), iota(s0 ∈ ℤ,(s0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[<](s0[+]1))))
  riotabidv(s0, cz, hs0 = c0, (s0[≤]hs0 ∧ hs0[<](s0[+]1)), (s0[≤]c0 ∧ c0[<](s0[+]1)))
  anbi12d(hs0 = c0, s0[≤]hs0, hs0[<](s0[+]1), s0[≤]c0, c0[<](s0[+]1))
  breq2(hs0, c0, s0, cle)
  breq1(hs0, c0, clt, (s0[+]1))
  df-fl(hs0, s0)
  riotaex(s0, cz, (s0[≤]c0 ∧ c0[<](s0[+]1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(iota(s0 ∈ ℤ,(s0[≤]c0 ∧ c0[<](s0[+]1))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm fllelt(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wa(wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))))
} = {
  mpbird(wcel(c0, cr), wa(wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(crio(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)))), cfv(cfl, c0)))
  eqcomd(crio(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)))), cfv(cfl, c0), wcel(c0, cr))
  flval(hs0, c0)
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cr), wb(wa(wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(crio(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)))), cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cz), wreu(hs0, cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)))))
  flcl(c0)
  rebtwnz(hs0, c0)
  riota2(hs0, cfv(cfl, c0), cz, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1))), wa(wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfl, c0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0)
  breq2d(c0, clt, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1), co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfl, c0)))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1)

  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cfl, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cz)

blocks.name: flge
blocks.content: The floor function value is the greatest integer less than or equal to its argument. (Contributed by NM, 15-Nov-2004.) (Proof shortened by Fan Zheng, 14-Jul-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm flge(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0))))
} = {
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)))
  sylibrd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1)))
  mpan2d(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c1, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1)), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1)))
  flltp1(c0)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wi(wa(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))), wbr(c1, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1), cr))
  zred(co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)))
  peano2zd(cfv(cfl, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)))
  lelttr(c1, c0, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)), wbr(c1, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cz))
  zleltp1(c1, cfv(cfl, c0))
  mpan2d(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0))
  flle(c0)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wi(wa(wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0)), wbr(c1, cle, c0)), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  zred(c1, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz))
  zred(cfv(cfl, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)))
  flcld(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz))
  letr(c1, cfv(cfl, c0), c0)
}

blocks.name: fllt
blocks.content: The floor function value is less than the next integer. (Contributed by NM, 24-Feb-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm fllt(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c0, clt, c1), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), clt, c1)))
} = {
  con4bid(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c0, clt, c1), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), clt, c1))
  3bitr3d(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz)), wn(wbr(c0, clt, c1)), wn(wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), clt, c1)), wbr(c1, cle, c0), wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)))
  flge(c0, c1)
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wn(wbr(c0, clt, c1))))
  sylan(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cr), wb(wbr(c1, cle, c0), wn(wbr(c0, clt, c1))), wcel(c1, cr))
  lenlt(c1, c0)
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)), wn(wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), clt, c1))), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cr))
  zre(c1)
  reflcl(c0)
  lenlt(c1, cfv(cfl, c0))
}

blocks.name: flid
blocks.content: An integer is its own floor. (Contributed by NM, 15-Nov-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm flid(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(cfv(cfl, c0), c0))
} = {
  mpbir2and(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(cfv(cfl, c0), c0), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wcel(c0, cr))
  flle(c0)
  mpbid(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(c0, cle, cfv(cfl, c0)), wbr(c0, cle, c0))
  leidd(c0, wcel(c0, cz))
  mpancom(wcel(c0, cz), wb(wbr(c0, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(c0, cr))
  flge(c0, c0)
  letri3d(cfv(cfl, c0), c0, wcel(c0, cz))
  syl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  reflcl(c0)
  zre(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm flid(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℤ →(⌊ ` c0)= c0)
} = {
  mpbir2and(c0 ∈ ℤ, (⌊ ` c0)= c0, (⌊ ` c0)[≤]c0, c0[≤](⌊ ` c0))
  syl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (⌊ ` c0)[≤]c0, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  flle(c0)
  mpbid(c0 ∈ ℤ, c0[≤](⌊ ` c0), c0[≤]c0)
  leidd(c0, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  mpancom(c0 ∈ ℤ, (c0[≤]c0 ↔ c0[≤](⌊ ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  flge(c0, c0)
  letri3d((⌊ ` c0), c0, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  syl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (⌊ ` c0)∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  reflcl(c0)
  zre(c0)
}

blocks.name: flidm
blocks.content: The floor function is idempotent. (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-2008.)

blocks.name: flidz
blocks.content: A real number equals its floor iff it is an integer. (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2008.)

blocks.name: flltnz
blocks.content: If A is not an integer, then the floor of A is less than A. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

  reflcl(c0)
  simpl(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz)))
  simpld(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz))), wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz)), wa(wbr(cfv(cfl, c0), cle, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(cfv(cfl, c0), caddc, nat1))))
  fllelt(c0)
  necomd(c0, cfv(cfl, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz))))
  neqned(cfv(cfl, c0), c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz))))
  mtbird(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz))), wceq(cfv(cfl, c0), c0), wcel(c0, cz))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wn(wcel(c0, cz)), wb(wceq(cfv(cfl, c0), c0), wcel(c0, cz)))
  flidz(c0)
}

thm flltnz(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ ¬ c0 ∈ ℤ)→(⌊ ` c0)[<]c0)

blocks.name: ceile

  ceilval(c0)

blocks.pretty:
thm ceilid(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℤ →(⌈ ` c0)= c0)
} = {
  3eqtrd((⌈ ` c0), c0, -u((⌊ ` -u(c0))), -u(-u(c0)), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  syl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (⌈ ` c0)= -u((⌊ ` -u(c0))), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  zre(c0)
  ceilval(c0)
  negeqd((⌊ ` -u(c0)), -u(c0), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  syl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (⌊ ` -u(c0))= -u(c0), -u(c0)∈ ℤ)
  znegcl(c0)
  flid(-u(c0))
  negnegd(c0, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  zcn(c0)
}

blocks.content: Quotient and remainder of a nonnegative integer divided by a positive integer. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm quoremnn0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn)), wa(wa(wcel(c2, cn0), wcel(c3, cn0)), wa(wbr(c3, clt, c1), wceq(c0, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, c3)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, c2)))
} = {
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn)), wa(wa(wcel(c2, cn0), wcel(c3, cn0)), wa(wbr(c3, clt, c1), wceq(c0, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, c3)))), wcel(c2, cn0), wa(wa(wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, cn0)), wa(wbr(c3, clt, c1), wceq(c0, co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, c3)))))

blocks.name: intfrac2
blocks.content: Decompose a real into integer and fractional parts. TODO - should we replace this with ~ intfrac ? (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm intfrac2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), w3a(wbr(nat0, cle, c1), wbr(c1, clt, nat1), wceq(c0, co(c2, caddc, c1))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cfl, c0))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c0, cmin, c2))
} = {
  3jca(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1), wbr(c1, clt, nat1), wceq(c0, co(c2, caddc, c1)))
  syl6breqr(nat0, cle, c1, co(c0, cmin, cfv(cfl, c0)), wcel(c0, cr))
  fracge0(c0)
  syl5eqbr(c1, clt, nat1, co(c0, cmin, cfv(cfl, c0)), wcel(c0, cr))
  eqtri(c1, co(c0, cmin, cfv(cfl, c0)), co(c0, cmin, c2))
  oveq2i(c0, cmin, c2, cfv(cfl, c0))
  fraclt1(c0)
  syl5req(c0, co(c2, caddc, c1), co(c2, caddc, co(c0, cmin, c2)), wcel(c0, cr))
  oveq2i(c2, caddc, c1, co(c0, cmin, c2))
  pncan3d(c2, c0, wcel(c0, cr))
  zcnd(c2, wcel(c0, cr))
  syl5eqel(c2, cz, cfv(cfl, c0), wcel(c0, cr))
  flcl(c0)
  recn(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm intfrac2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℝ →(0[≤]c1 ∧ c1[<]1 ∧ c0 =(c2[+]c1)))
  ⊣ c2 =(⌊ ` c0)
  ⊣ c1 =(c0[-]c2)
} = {
  3jca(c0 ∈ ℝ, 0[≤]c1, c1[<]1, c0 =(c2[+]c1))
  syl6breqr(nat0, cle, c1, (c0[-](⌊ ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  fracge0(c0)
  syl5eqbr(c1, clt, nat1, (c0[-](⌊ ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  eqtri(c1, (c0[-](⌊ ` c0)), (c0[-]c2))
  oveq2i(c0, cmin, c2, (⌊ ` c0))
  fraclt1(c0)
  syl5req(c0, (c2[+]c1), (c2[+](c0[-]c2)), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  oveq2i(c2, caddc, c1, (c0[-]c2))
  pncan3d(c2, c0, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  zcnd(c2, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  syl5eqel(c2, cz, (⌊ ` c0), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  flcl(c0)
  recn(c0)
}

  ltmuldiv2(c2, c1, c1)
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn)), wb(wbr(co(c1, cmul, c2), clt, c1), wbr(co(c1, cmul, c2), cle, co(c1, cmin, nat1))), wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cz), wcel(c1, cz))

  syl5eq(co(c1, cmul, c2), co(co(c1, cmul, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmin, co(c1, cmul, c3)), co(c1, cmul, co(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cmin, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn)))

blocks.name: fldiv

blocks.origin:
thm fldiv(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(cfv(cfl, co(cfv(cfl, c0), cdiv, c1)), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))
